item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Just Puja Samagri is a rare vision of Mrs. Rina Jha, an MBA graduate in Financial Management whose passion and positive approach expanded to provide extensive range of puja items kit online, thus giving birth to this company. Spending 5 years in corporate business extensively, she came up as entrepreneur with the thinking of her own E-Commerce business.

India is a country where The day of every Indian starts with the worship of God and ends with his name resounding in the mind. Performing Puja is the integral part of daily routine of mankind. Worship of God plays a very important role in the spiritual, personal and as well as the professional life of an individual. Thus, puja items are a requisite in the shopping list for a house that exudes an aura of peace and divine ecstasy.

Organizing a puja ceremony, requires a wide assortment of puja samagri to be put together. Gathering all the required puja items can be a very arduous task. Pacing up and down from place to place, waiting in line for hours and paying handsome amount of money at puja stores can now be avoided in the blink of an eye.

Justpujasamagri brings to you an extensive range of puja items kit online which you can purchase at discounted rates, that too from the comfort of your home. In todays life style & in the cities we live we dont have much time to go out for shopping, so JUSTPUJASAMAGRI has tried to collect all the puja items at one place , where you can buy at one go. If you have any specific requirement,please feel free to contact us at contact At justpujasamagri or rinajha At justpujasamagri USP: we will deliver to you what we have promised. we ensure purity..

[toggle title="What kind of products we are offering ?"]We have a wide variety of Puja Kits, Puja Special Sarees, Corporate Kits, Dwali Gifts & customize kit option. We provide not only your selected items to you but we are giving you our trust, faith , purity, & ample of quality time for your loved ones. [/toggle] [toggle title="How much time it would take ?"]Puja kit is delivered to you through courier. You should receive the order in DELHI/NCR Zone within 48hours of putting down your order. In Metro cities orders will be delivered within 2-4 business days & in rest of India kit will be delivered in 4-6 business days.[/toggle] [toggle title="How to place an order with us ?"]
  • Visit us on www.justpujasamagri.com & select the puja kit as per your choice/liking/requirement by clicking on the puja kits, selecting your preferred kit and finally clicking on add to cart .
  • Choose between continue shopping if you would like to add other puja items,or checkout if you are done shopping.
  • If you are a new customer, register with your contact details. Otherwise click on already registered and fill your email and password information to login.
  • Choose your desired payment method and confirm the order. You enjoy your precious time with your family and we will take care of the rest!.
[/toggle] [toggle title="Are our website trusted for online payments ?"]We actually use industry-leading encryption standards! This encrypts the data you provide to us, ensures it is safe and not accessible to any third party. Your data is only used to process orders and to serve you better. It will be under no circumstances disclosed to any third party. For more information, please check Terms & Conditions page.[/toggle] [toggle title="Why Payu Money ?"]We can help you to protect your purchases anywhere you shop when you pay through PayUMoney. Just in case your product doesn't get delivered or is significantly different from its description, we can help get all your money back or get a replacement product.[/toggle] [toggle title="Why Direct Bank Transfer As Payment option ?"]Direct Bank Transfer is often the most expedient method for transferring funds between bank accounts. The transfer messages are sent via a secure system SWIFT utilizing BIC codes. Online bank transfer system is alternative payment methods, where the bank transfer is authorized by the consumer who logs onto his bank website and authorizes the funds transfer for payment to a merchant.[/toggle]

USE OF E-MAIL ADDRESS

SECURITY

We have implemented and follow reasonable industry standard technical and procedural measures to protect against unauthorized access and use of your personal information. However, you should know that neither we nor any other web site can fully eliminate these risks. Our goal is to provide you with a robust online experience while safeguarding your privacy. We request this information to provide our strongest value to you - a personalized online experience, so we do everything we can to make JustPujaSamagri your preferred online destination, and to provide you the content, products and services that might interest you.

CHANGE TO THIS POLICY

JustPujaSamagri may edit this policy from time to time. If we make any substantial changes we will notify you by posting a prominent announcement on our pages. item.excerpt:encoded:
Lord SatyaNarayan is another form of Lord Vishnu. A Narayan form of Lord Vishnu is considered an embodiment of truth. SatyaNarayan puja is most popular and powerful puja in hindu deity. It is believed that this puja has the power to help one attain what one desires and leads to overall prosperity and happiness.evening is the best time to perform this puja, however one can do it in morning as well.

item.excerpt:encoded:
Vat Savitri Vrat, is a fast observed by married Hindu women in North India for the wellbeing of their husbands and children. The fasting is named after Savitri, who brought back her husband from the clutches of Yama (death). Women then worship the Banyan Tree (Vat Vriksha). After praying to the Banyan Tree, a red or yellow colored thread is tied around the tree. Then water, rice and flowers are offered as part of the puja. Women then go round the tree and chant prayers.
We have assembled in this kit all ingredients for performing Vat Savitri puja. All the essentials packed are natural, pure, sacred and of high quality and are sufficient for performing puja.

Rudrabhishek is a ritual of worshipping Lord Shiva in his Rudra form, in which a Shivalinga is bathed in water which is continuously poured over it, with accompaniment of the chanting of vedic mantra called the Rudra Suktha. Lord Shiva grants them their wishes and give them mukthi(salvation). During Prodhosha time anointing Abhishekam the Shiva deity with the following is considered fruitful. Milk gives long life Ghee gives Moksha state Curd gives good children Honey is considered most sacred by Hindus and helps derive benefits of having worshipped all Devatas at one go. Rudrabhishek nullifies the bad effects of debilitated chandra graha as well as evil effect of Punarvasu, Pushya, Ashlesha Nakshatras and make it powerful and beneficial.

item.excerpt:encoded: Karva Chauth is a one-day festival celebrated by Hindu women in North India in which married women fast from sunrise to moonrise for the safety and longevity of their husbands. Karwa Chauth is a festival that provides an opportunity for all married women to get close to their in-laws. All married women observes fast that ensures the well-being, prosperity and longevity of their husbands. Married women keep a strict fast and do not take even a drop of water. They get up early in the morning, perform their ablutions, and wear new and festive raiment. Shiva, Parvati and their son Kartikeya are worshiped on this day along with the 10 'karwas' (earthen pots) filled with sweets. The Karwas are given to daughters and sisters along with gifts.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Karva Chauth or KARWACHAUTH is a one-day festival celebrated by Hindu women.Buy or order online

Madhushravani Festival or Madhu Sravani Puja is a main festival observed in Mithilanchal. Madhushravani is celebrated in Shravan Month (July August) for consecutive 13 days and ends on Shravan Shukla Tritiya with elaborate pooja and feasting. During this festival, women worship Naga devatas (Serpent Gods), Gauri, Shanti Kalash, Surya, Chandrama, Navagrah, and several Nags such as Nag dampati, Bairasi along with hundred brothers, Chanai, Kusumawati, Pingla, Lili, Gosauni nag with seven sisters,and lastly Shasthi or sathi .

item.excerpt:encoded:
Bhai Dooj is also called 'Yama Dwiteeya' as it's believed that on this day, Yamaraj, the Lord of Death and the Custodian of Hell, visits his sister Yami, who puts the auspicious mark on his forehead and prays for his well being. So it's held that anyone who receives a tilak from his sister on this day would never be hurled into hell & get protection from evil forces.
We have assembled in this kit all ingredients for performing Bhai Duj puja. All the essentials packed are natural, pure, sacred and of high quality and are sufficient for performing puja.

item.excerpt:encoded: This pooja is all about worshipping goddess Parvati. It falls during the fourth or fifth day of Ganesh Chaturthi. It is vital for strengthening bonds of love, and good luck is bestowed upon an individual by conducting Gauri pooja. This is a form of worship of Goddess Durga, performed especially during the Ganpati Utsav in Maharashtra. This pooja is performed with Suhaag Samagri (materials needed in marriages). Married women do this in order to pray for the long life of their better half, adolescent girls perform the pooja to get a desired partner and the pooja is also conducted to fulfil wishes of people. We have assembled in this kit all ingredients for performing Gauri/ Gangaur puja. All the essentials packed are natural, pure, sacred and of high quality and are sufficient for performing puja.

item.excerpt:encoded:
Nakshatras assume significant importance in the lives of many. Mool shanti pooja is conducted to alleviate the sufferings and negativity arising due to birth under inappropriate nakshatras which are the negative mool Nakshatras. They include Ashwaini, Magha, Jayeshta, Aslesha, Mool and Revati.
In order to eliminate and pale the inauspiciousness arising due to this, a Mool shanti pooja is conducted on the 27th day after the birth of a new born. It is believed that the parent is not supposed to get a glimpse of the child before this.

item.excerpt:encoded:
The Hanuman Chalisa is a Hindu devotional chant directed towards lord Hanuman. It is traditionally regarded to have been composed by Tulsidas in the Awadhi language. The word "chls" has evolved from "chls", which means the number forty in Hindi, as the Hanuman Chalisa has 40 verses (excluding the couplets at the beginning and at the end).
The attributes of Hanuman his strength, courage, wisdom, celibacy, devotion to Rama and the many names by which he was acknowledged are enumerated in the Hanuman Chalisa. There is a tradition of chanting the hanuman chalisa 100 times. Clothed in red garments, seated on a red chair (aasan), if a person recites the chalisa, it is believed that all his wishes are granted by lord Hanuman.
We have assembled in this kit all ingredients for performing Hanuman Chalisa Path Puja. All the essentials packed are natural, pure, sacred and of high quality and are sufficient for performing puja.

The Ram Charitra Manas by Tulsidas has unparalleled importance in the hindu scriptures and tradition. This text is considered to be a form of god and worshipped widely. The text gives a description of the character of god Ramchandra and it defines the very principles of humanity. It is a reflection of religious and ethical codes of conduct and ways of living. By keeping this text in the house, the welfare of the household is taken care of. Commonly, the text is also called the 'Akhand Ramayana'.
If one is going through tough times due to financial instability of halted tasks, a person is ensured with economic support and help if he reads the text.. It also leads to peace of mind. Unity in the family is restored. Belief in god is strengthened. Atonement of Sins committed by a person is possible once this Akhand Ramayana Path pooja is done.

item.title: Aachmani Panchpatra
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Price- Rs. 75
Panch Patra (Aachman Cup) with Spoon. A solid copper vessel or 'panchpatra' with a rim, ideally used in the pooja altar to offer or pour water or 'charanamrit' to the deities. Use it as a 'mandir' accessory or gift it to someone who can use it purposefully. This beautiful Pandchpatra set is certain to add grace to your Mandir ( Temple) at home. Puja in a daily custom in a typical Hindu and generally comprises of lighting a lamp and incense sticks before the God followed by making offerings of food and ringing the bell. Hymns and Mantras are recited while doing the Puja. This set comprises of the panchpatra which is a small copper glass shared utensil used for offering water / milk to the deities. Generally a few Tulsi leaves (Basil) is also added to the water to impart its refreshing flavor and nutrients. This water offered to the deities, is considered as holy, and is distributed among the devotees using the Achmani ( spoon). It is also well known fact that Tulsi is widely worshiped in India, and it is believed that fresh Tulsi leaves should never be chewed. Therefore, it is generally offered with water so that it can easily be swallowed so that it is beneficial to the health. These are easy to maintain products and are dish washer friendly and non breakable. Aachmani Panchpatra at the discounted cheaper price.

item.title: Dhoti
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: It is mentioned in the Shastras that one should always wear a pavitra / fresh (clean and washed) cloth while doing pooja everyday. And 'Dhoti' is the purest forms of cloth. Dhoti is the recommended cloth while doing puja, yajna, attending religious ceremonies. It is made to be washed everyday and easily dried up to wear every next day. This can be an ideal gift for Gurus, Sadhus and Elders too. For the word itself means 'Dho' (wash) + 'ti' (wear fresh next day). Dhoti at discounted and cheaper price.
item.excerpt:encoded: Indian traditional wear. -used for performing puja as it is considered pure for worship. Length- 4.5 Meter
